org.miktim.websocket

Class WebSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.miktim.websocket.WebSocket

  • public class WebSocket
extends java.lang.Object
    WebSocket servers and client connections factory.

        Throws:

      • closeAll

        public void closeAll(java.lang.String reason)
        Closes all servers/connections within this WebSocket instance.

        Connections close status code 1001 (GOING_AWAY).

        Parameters:
        reason - connection close reason. String of 123 BYTES length.
        See Also:
        WsStatus

      • closeAll

        public void closeAll()
        Closes all servers/connections within this WebSocket instance.

        Connections close status code 1001 (GOING_AWAY).

        See Also:
        WsStatus

      • Server

        @Deprecated
public WsServer Server(int port,
                                   WsConnection.Handler handler,
                                   WsParameters wsp)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Deprecated. Use startServer methods instead.
        Creates WebSocket server for insecure connections. Start the server instance using the start() or launch() methods.
        Parameters:
        port - listening port.
        handler - server side connection handler.
        wsp - server side connection parameters.
        Returns:
        WebSocket server instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

      • startSecureServer

        public WsServer startSecureServer(int port,
                                  WsConnection.Handler handler,
                                  WsParameters wsp)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Creates and starts WebSocket server for TLS connections.
        Parameters:
        port - listening port.
        handler - server side connection handler.
        If you need to handle server events, extend the connection handler with a server handler. For example: 
         interface MyServerHandler extends WsConnection.Handler, WsServer.Handler {};
        wsp - server side connection parameters.
        Returns:
        WebSocket server instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Since:
        4.3

      • startSecureServer

        public WsServer startSecureServer(int port,
                                  WsConnection.Handler handler)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Creates and starts WebSocket server for TLS connections with default connection parameters.
        Parameters:
        port - listening port.
        handler - server side connection handler.
        If you need to handle server events, extend the connection handler with a server handler. For example: 
         interface MyServerHandler extends WsConnection.Handler, WsServer.Handler {};
        Returns:
        WebSocket server instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Since:
        4.3

      • startServer

        public WsServer startServer(int port,
                            WsConnection.Handler handler,
                            WsParameters wsp)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Creates and starts WebSocket server for insecure connections
        Parameters:
        port - listening port number
        handler - server side connection handler.
        If you need to handle server events, extend the connection handler with a server handler. For example: 
         interface MyServerHandler extends WsConnection.Handler, WsServer.Handler {};
        wsp - server side connection parameters
        Returns:
        WebSocket server instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Since:
        4.3

        Creates and starts WebSocket server for insecure connections with default connection parameters
        Parameters:

        handler - server side connection handler.
        If you need to handle server events, extend the connection handler with a server handler. For example: 
         interface MyServerHandler extends WsConnection.Handler, WsServer.Handler {};

      • connect

        public WsConnection connect(java.lang.String uri,
                            WsConnection.Handler handler,
                            WsParameters wsp)
                     throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Creates and starts WebSocket client connection.
        Parameters:
        uri - connection uri string like:
        scheme://[user-info@]host[:port][/path][?query][#fragment]
        - uri's scheme (ws: | wss:) and host are required;
        - :port (80 | 443), /path and ?query are optional;
        - user-info@ and #fragment are ignored.
        handler - client side connection handler.
        wsp - client side connection parameters.
        Returns:
        WebSocket connection instance.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException

      • connect

        public WsConnection connect(java.lang.String uri,
                            WsConnection.Handler handler)
                     throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Creates and starts WebSocket client connection
        Parameters:
        uri - uri string
        handler - client side connecton handler
        Returns:
        WebSocket connection instance
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Since:
        4.3
